title.narrative: IR 4.1 DONNEES, ANALYSE ET EVALUATION

description.narrative: Intermediate Results (IR) 4.1: By the end of 2018, the availability of disaggregated data and ongoing analysis of the situation of children and women inform the development of social policies and budgets for the welfare of all children, which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation And Research, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: CHILDREN RIGHTS ENABLING ENVIRONMENTPCR4 : By the end of 2018, laws, social policies, planning, budgets, expenditures, public opinion and social norms are informed by ongoing analysis of the situation of children, monitoring and evaluation and promote an environment conducive to the full-implementation of children's rights

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 4.1: By the end of 2018, the availability of disaggregated data and ongoing analysis of the situation of children and womeninform the development of social policies and budgets for the welfare of all children

description.narrative: The Multi Indicators Cluster Survey (MICS), completed in 2019, has provided disaggregated data on social and demographic indicators for the 26 provinces in DRC. Its release has been instrumental for the Government and partners to support national and provincial evidences-based programming. The MICS data informed the design of the 2019-2023 National Strategic Plan for Development (PNSD) and the 2020-2024 United Nations Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework (UNSDCF) and strongly contributed to the formulation of 2020-2024 UNICEF country programme. Increased implementation rate of studies and evaluations recommendations from 39% (2018) to 52% (2019) contributed to continuous improvement of programmes implementation. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:05/02/2020
